poem:
### Declaration

In power's shadow,  
a rustling of dark wings—  
truth bound and gagged,  
words falter as morning breaks.  
A man speaks,  
not to heal but to taunt,  
where justice waits,  
cloaked in disdain.  
The earth sighs,  
its timber groaning  
for integrity lost  
amid the clamor  
of unchecked boasts.
